iajoiner commented on PR #13531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13531#issuecomment-1177822539

   Ok looks like the bug no longer exists in Arrow 8.0.0 likely due to the fix to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16025. These additional tests in C++ & Python are still good to add though just in case future updates break them.

iajoiner commented on PR #13531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13531#issuecomment-1177824238

   All tests have passed except for two that have nothing to do with the PR. Please review.

wjones127 commented on PR #13531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13531#issuecomment-1282972879

   @pitrou Are we still trying to get this into 10.0.0? Or can this be bumped to 11.0.0?
   
   I can work on this regardless.

pitrou commented on PR #13531:

   It can probably be bumped IMHO.

wjones127 closed pull request #13531: ARROW-16817: [C++][Python] Fix segfaults in the ORC writer when unsupported datatypes are given

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: In the ORC writer if a table has at least a column with unsupported datatype segfaults occur when we try to write them in ORC.
fields.summary: [C++][Python] Segfaults for unsupported datatypes in the ORC writer
